Abstract: In a beautiful, almost ethereal scene, about 2,000 Christians quietly ascended the Mount of Olives as midnight approached. Following a lighted crucifix, they carried votive candles that flickered in the still darkness of a city devoid of any official celebration of the millennium.     At the top, they planted the crucifix and gathered round, moved by the serenity. Then, switching in a flash from the sublime to the cheesy, it turned into a Dick Clark New Year's Eve special with a Fellini-esque cast, set in the heart of the Holy Land.
LeadParagraph: In a beautiful, almost ethereal scene, about 2,000 Christians quietly ascended the Mount of Olives as midnight approached. Following a lighted crucifix, they carried votive candles that flickered in the still darkness of a city devoid of any official celebration of the millennium.

Headline.Main: Solemnity and Flash In the Land of Jesus
Headline.PrintHeadline: 1/1/00: AROUND THE WORLD; Solemnity and Flash In the Land of Jesus

Byline.Original: By Deborah Sontag and William A. Orme Jr
